data.description: Recognized as the No. 1 site trusted by real estate professionals, Realtor.com® has been at the forefront of online real estate for over 25 years, connecting buyers, sellers, and renters with trusted insights and expert guidance to find their perfect home. Through its robust suite of tools, Realtor.com® not only makes a significant impact on the real estate industry at large, but for consumers, navigating the biggest purchase they will make in their life, by providing a user experience that is easy to use, easy to understand, and most of all, easy to make decisions. Join us on our mission to empower more people to find their way home by breaking barriers to entry, making the right connections, and building confidence through expert guidance.Data Analytics Intern Location: Austin, TX (Hybrid: 3 days in-office required, 2 remote)Duration: 11 weeks | Summer 2026 (June 1, 2026 through August 14,2026)Relocation and visa sponsorship are not available Start Your Future with Realtor.com® At Realtor.com®, we’re driven by a purposeful vision: to help more Americans find their way home. For more than 25 years, we’ve helped millions of people navigate the journey of renting, buying, and selling homes. As part of our consumer marketplace, data plays a critical role in shaping how we engage users across marketing, CRM, and product experiences. Join us this summer and gain hands-on experience using data to influence real business decisions across the consumer side of the marketplace. Why Intern With Us? Our Summer Internship Program is more than a resume builder—it’s a launchpad. As a Data Analytics Intern, you’ll work on real, high-impact projects, collaborate with experienced data scientists and analysts, and learn how data informs strategy across marketing, consumer engagement, and consumer product experiences. You’ll receive mentorship, build technical and analytical skills, and gain exposure to how analytics supports decision-making at scale. What You’ll Do Throughout the 11-week program, you will: Support data scientists and analysts in analyzing consumer behavior and performance metrics across marketing, CRM, and/or product experiences Assist with exploratory data analysis, reporting, and dashboarding to help teams understand trends and performance drivers Learn and apply statistical and analytical techniques, including exposure to experimentation (A/B testing) and measurement best practices Help translate analytical findings into clear insights and data stories for cross-functional stakeholders Contribute to data pipelines, data validation, and visualization workflows that support analytics and experimentation Collaborate with partners across analytics, data engineering, marketing, and product teams to understand business context and analytical needs Present your work and learnings to the team at the end of the internship Who You Are Curious, analytical, and motivated to learn how data drives business decisions Comfortable working with ambiguity and eager to solve open-ended problems Able to communicate insights clearly, both verbally and in writing Interested in how analytics supports consumer growth, engagement, and experience A collaborative teammate who takes initiative and seeks feedback Requirements Currently enrolled in an accredited 4-year college or university, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Analytics, Business, Engineering, or a related field Expected graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027 Experience or coursework in one or more of the following: SQL, Python, R, or data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) Familiarity with data concepts such as metrics, data quality, and basic statistical analysis Able to complete the full 11-week internship and work in Austin, TX on a hybrid schedule (3 days in office and 2 remote) Strong attention to detail, professionalism, and willingness to take on new challenges Nice to Have (Not Required) Exposure to experimentation concepts (e.g., A/B testing, hypothesis testing) Experience working with large datasets or consumer-focused data Coursework or projects involving data storytelling, dashboards, or analytics tools What to Expect Internship postings: December 2025 - January 2026 Interviews begin: January 2026 Executive speaker series, team workshops, networking events, and mentorship opportunities Exposure to Realtor.com®’s inclusive culture and commitment to innovation Make Your Mark at Realtor.com® Your first internship should be meaningful. At Realtor.com®, you’ll gain real experience, grow your skills, and help shape data-informed decisions that impact millions of consumers across our marketplace. Ready to build a way home for everyone? Apply and join us for Summer 2026. Please note: Our Internship Program is based in Austin, TX, and follows a hybrid schedule (three days on-site, two days remote). Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance are not available for this program. Make Your Mark at Realtor.com®You only get one first internship, so make it count. At Realtor.com®, you’ll do more than gain experience—you’ll make an impact, grow your network, and help us build a better future for home. Ready to build a way home for everyone? Apply and join us in Summer 2026. Do the best work of your life at Realtor.com® Here, you’ll partner with a diverse team of experts as you use leading-edge tech to empower everyone to meet a crucial goal: finding their way home. And you’ll find your way home too. At Realtor.com®, you’ll bring your full self to work as you innovate with speed, serve our consumers, and champion your teammates. In return, we’ll provide you with a warm, welcoming, and inclusive culture; intellectual challenges; and the development opportunities you need to grow. Diversity is important to us, therefore, Realtor.com® is an Equal Opportunity Employer regardless of age, color, national origin, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, status as a disabled veteran and/or veteran of the Vietnam Era or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Realtor.com® will provide reasonable accommodations for otherwise qualified disabled individuals.
requirements: Support data scientists and analysts in analyzing consumer behavior and performance metrics across marketing, CRM, and/or product experiences
Interested in how analytics supports consumer growth, engagement, and experience

Currently enrolled in an accredited 4-year college or university, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Analytics, Business, Engineering, or a related field
Experience or coursework in one or more of the following: SQL, Python, R, or data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
Experience working with large datasets or consumer-focused data
